physical_appearance: "This is a set containing a tea cup and a saucer. They both depict Saint Ignatius of Loyola. The saint is dressed in a chasuble, and in his left hand holds a volume of the abbreviated Jesuit motto ""Ad Maiorem Dei Gloriam"". Symbolic of his elevated status
title_text: St Ignatius of Loyola tea bowl and saucer
subject_terms_1: he has a ray of light around his head. Both on the inner lip of the teacup and the saucer Jesuit (Chinese ceramics style)  Jesuit (Christian order)  teacups  saucers (plates)
subject_terms_2: is a floral gilding. " Jesuits  Teacups  Bolswert, Schelte, approximately 1586-1659  Rubens, Peter Paul, 1577-1640  Portrait  Porcelain  Saints
techniques_name: enameling throwing (pottery techniques)  molding (forming)  firing (technique)  porcelain painting (image-making) gilding (technique)  freehand drawing (technique)
